docs.lead_paragraph: THE stories told in these pages today reveal the progress made by the Hundred Neediest Cases of 1930 in the six months that have elapsed since the appeal for help was made in THE NEW YORK TIMES at the Christmas season.

headline.main: NO LONGER CAN THEY BE CALLED THE HUNDRED NEEDIEST; The Christmas Fund Given by the Readers of The New York Times Has Changed the Lives of Many Families in Distress NO LONGER CAN THEY BE CALLED THE HUNDRED NEEDIEST The Christmas Fund Given by the Readers of The New York Times Has Changed the Lives of Many Families in Distress
